intro: Taveunia, commonly known as the red lily, is a striking plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy red flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant belongs to the family Iridaceae and is closely related to the genus Gladiolus. Taveunia thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in tropical and subtropical regions.
